report_title: KJET Nakuru County Application Ranking and Evaluation

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Long-standing registration (since 1982) with extensive operational history.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Excellent financial health with consistent growth in turnover and net surplus over multiple years.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Proven demand with active offtake agreements and aggressive market share strategy.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Clear, detailed proposal focused on capacity expansion and logistics improvement with high projected ROI.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Critical role in Dairy value chain, providing aggregation, processing, and extension services to members.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: High marks for sustainability (biogas plant, tree-planting) and inclusivity (>30% women in leadership).

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Registered for over three years (since 2021) with clear operational history.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Strong financial health with consistent upward trend in turnover and net profit.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Well-defined strategy to diversify into high-value products (cheese, yogurt) for competitive edge.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Robust plan with clear objectives, but funding proposal detail could be more granular.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Plays a critical role in milk aggregation, processing, and distribution.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Woman-owned, female General Manager, and strong commitment to waste repurposing (whey) and solar exploration.

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Long operational history and strong brand recognition.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Stable financial performance but with some recent pressure on liquidity.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Established market presence and clear strategy for product innovation.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Solid, measurable goals for modernizing infrastructure and expanding cold chain logistics.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Major player in the Dairy value chain, providing critical processing capacity for the region.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Utilizes a biogas digester for waste management, demonstrating environmental responsibility.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Positive revenue trend based on bank statements, but profitability data is less clear.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Focus on high-value products (brown cheese) with an initial B2B contract, but limited market depth currently.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Clear proposal to invest in feed hardware and land acquisition to control input costs and expand services.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Essential role in member support, milk aggregation, and value addition (cheese).

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Qualifies as woman-owned (self-declared) and provides AI services/drought-resistant fodder to farmers.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Shows revenue growth and recently returned to a net surplus, indicating improving financial health.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Strong plan to enter the UHT milk market and expand to the Western Kenya region.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Proposal is clear, focusing on distribution infrastructure (Vans, warehouses) to support new product lines.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Central player in aggregation, processing, marketing, and member support in the Dairy value chain.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Uses solar power for water pumping and has an existing wastewater management initiative for upgrade.

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Strong track record in the Textiles sector.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: High competitiveness due to its unique position in textile recycling and multi-channel sales.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Comprehensive proposal with quantified targets for expansion of recycling and production capacity.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Strong alignment by promoting circular economy, but the application could better articulate its direct linkage to primary textile manufacturing/processing.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Woman-owned, >50% women/youth, but the sustainable practices description was slightly less detailed than top applicants.

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Registered association with over five years of operation.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Positive turnover trend, but relies heavily on grants/external funding for key operations.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Consistent monthly orders with a clear plan to expand into the uniform market.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Clear plan to upgrade equipment (weaving looms) to increase production volume and quality.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: A key player in the Textiles value chain, providing spinning and weaving services to local cotton farmers.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: Strong inclusivity (>50% female workforce), but sustainable practice (solar) is not yet fully implemented across all operations.

ineligible_applicants.reason: The cluster operates in 'Agri-business' which is outside the designated priority value chains (Dairy, Edible Oils, Textiles, Construction, Rice, Tea, Blue Economy).
The entity is registered as a 'Business Name' (BN-XXXXXXXX) which is not a recognized legally recognized cluster entity (MSME association, cooperative, or company) for this program.
